medea2.speech: I am full of glee that thee has summoned me, come tell me, what is on your mind?
This task my father has given you is impossible,if the bulls do not slay you, the army will. If the army does not slay you, the dragon will.
Do not worry for me young beauty as I have the will of the gods behind me.
Not even the gods could prevent you from burning to death. Retrieve for  me the root of a two stalked flower, similar to the Corycian crocus, so that I can make a solution for you.

medea3.speech: When the task of plowing with bulls comes, place the ointment upon thee so that thou be resistant to their flames
Return to the palace, My father will have retrieved the dragonsteeth by now
